meaning.example: Harris tweed is made from pure new wool

meaning.definition: a thing resembling wool, in particular:
meaning.example: beaver wool

meaning.definition: the words used to express something; the way in which something is expressed.
meaning.example: the standard form of wording for a consent letter

meaning.definition: express (something spoken or written) in particular words.
meaning.example: he words his request in a particularly ironic way

meaning.definition: extending or reaching throughout the world.
meaning.example: worldwide sales of television rights

meaning.definition: throughout the world.
meaning.example: she travels worldwide as a consultant

meaning.definition: of the poorest quality or the lowest standard; least good or desirable.
meaning.example: he was the company's worst driver

meaning.definition: worth the time, money, or effort spent; of value or importance.
meaning.example: extra lighting would make a worthwhile contribution to road safety

meaning.definition: cover or enclose in paper or soft material.
meaning.example: he wrapped up the Christmas presents

meaning.definition: extreme anger.
meaning.example: he hid his pipe for fear of incurring his father's wrath

meaning.definition: the destruction of a ship at sea; a shipwreck.
meaning.example: the survivors of the wreck

meaning.definition: something, especially a vehicle or building, that has been badly damaged or destroyed.
meaning.example: the plane was reduced to a smouldering wreck

meaning.definition: a person whose physical or mental health or strength has failed.
meaning.example: the scandal left the family emotional wrecks

meaning.definition: cause the destruction of (a ship) by sinking or breaking up.
meaning.example: he was drowned when his ship was wrecked

meaning.definition: destroy or severely damage (a structure, vehicle, or similar).
meaning.example: the blast wrecked 100 houses

meaning.definition: Mechanics
a sudden violent twist or pull.
meaning.example: with a wrench Tony wriggled free

meaning.definition: a feeling of sadness or distress caused by one's own or another's departure.
meaning.example: it will be a real wrench to leave after eight years

meaning.definition: an adjustable tool like a spanner, used for gripping and turning nuts or bolts.
meaning.example: you will need a wrench to tighten it in position

meaning.definition: take part in a fight, either as sport or in earnest, that involves grappling with one's opponent and trying to throw or force them to the ground.
meaning.example: as the policeman wrestled with the gunman a shot rang out

meaning.definition: (of a person) in a very unhappy or unfortunate state.
meaning.example: I felt so wretched because I thought I might never see you again

meaning.definition: squeeze and twist (something) to force liquid from it.
meaning.example: she wrung the cloth out in the sink

meaning.definition: break (an animal's neck) by twisting it forcibly.
meaning.example: the chicken shrieked as one of the women wrung its neck

meaning.definition: a slight line or fold in something, especially fabric or the skin of the face.
meaning.example: she smoothed out the wrinkles from her skirt

meaning.definition: make or cause lines or folds in (something, especially fabric or the skin).
meaning.example: Dotty's wrinkled stockings

meaning.definition: the joint connecting the hand with the forearm.
meaning.example: I fell over and sprained my wrist

meaning.definition: race or cruise in a yacht.
a medium-sized sailing boat equipped for cruising or racing.
meaning.example: an eighty-five-foot diesel yacht

meaning.definition: a unit of linear measure equal to 3 feet (0.9144 metre).
meaning.example: a full skirt that took twenty yards of cloth

meaning.definition: involuntarily open one's mouth wide and inhale deeply due to tiredness or boredom.
meaning.example: he began yawning and looking at his watch

meaning.definition: be wide open.
meaning.example: a yawning chasm

meaning.definition: a reflex act of opening one's mouth wide and inhaling deeply due to tiredness or boredom.
meaning.example: he stretches and stifles a yawn

meaning.definition: have an intense feeling of longing for something, typically something that one has lost or been separated from.
meaning.example: she yearned for a glimpse of him

meaning.definition: a microscopic fungus consisting of single oval cells that reproduce by budding, and capable of converting sugar into alcohol and carbon dioxide.
meaning.example: plural noun: yeasts

meaning.definition: produce or provide (a natural, agricultural, or industrial product).
meaning.example: the land yields grapes and tobacco

meaning.definition: give way to arguments, demands, or pressure.
meaning.example: the Western powers now yielded when they should have resisted

meaning.definition: (of a mass or structure) give way under force or pressure.
meaning.example: he reeled into the house as the door yielded

meaning.definition: an amount produced of an agricultural or industrial product.
meaning.example: the milk yield was poor

meaning.definition: a frame fitting over the neck and shoulders of a person, used for carrying pails or baskets.
the crossbar of a rudder.
a wooden crosspiece that is fastened over the necks of two animals and attached to the plough or cart that they are to pull.
meaning.example: the horses were loosened from the yoke

meaning.definition: a part of a garment that fits over the shoulders and to which the main part of the garment is attached.
meaning.example: the pinafore fell amply from a short yoke

meaning.definition: put a yoke on (a pair of animals); couple or attach with or to a yoke.
meaning.example: a plough drawn by a camel and donkey yoked together

meaning.definition: a thing whose name one cannot recall, does not know, or does not wish to specify.
meaning.example: how much did that yoke set you back?

meaning.definition: the yellow internal part of a bird's egg, which is surrounded by the white, is rich in protein and fat, and nourishes the developing embryo.
meaning.example: two yolks

meaning.definition: great energy or enthusiasm in pursuit of a cause or an objective.
meaning.example: his zeal for privatization

meaning.definition: having or showing zeal.
meaning.example: the council was extremely zealous in the application of the regulations

meaning.definition: divide into or assign to zones.
meaning.example: noun: zoning

meaning.definition: an area or stretch of land having a particular characteristic, purpose, or use, or subject to particular restrictions.
meaning.example: a pedestrian zone

meaning.definition: the scientific study of the behaviour, structure, physiology, classification, and distribution of animals.
meaning.example: the zoology of Russia's vast interior
